snippet: The volatile Republican nominating contest is not likely to be followed by a volatile general election fight with President Obama.
abstract: Political Memo; 2012 presidential campaign, marked by mercurial public enthusiasm for a host of different candidates, is unlikely to stabilize now that Republicans have begun rallying around Mitt Romney; will likely remain narrowly contested, revolving around the mobilization of party loyalists and an attempt to win over a small slice of voters who will remain undecided until almost the end.
lead_paragraph: The volatile Republican nominating contest is not likely to be followed by a volatile general election fight with President Obama.

headline.seo: Presidential Campaign Expected to Be Narrowly Contested
headline.main: After a Rollicking Primary, a Different Kind of Fight in November
headline.print_headline: After a Rollicking Primary, a Different Kind of Fight in November
